intro: Bivonaea prolongoi, commonly known as the long-stemmed bivonaea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, elongated stems that can grow up to several meters in height, supporting its showy yellow and orange inflorescences. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Bivonaea prolongoi is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
